description: Borrowed from Middle French eviter, from Latin ēvītō (“to avoid”).

verbs.description: evite (third-person singular simple present evites, present participle eviting, simple past and past participle evited)

entries.meaning: (now rare, chiefly Scotland, transitive) To avoid.
examples: The way which our adversaries take to evite this testimony, is most foolish and ridiculous:  […]
